task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 177°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and full vertical extent to estimate height, so I will tilt the view upward while staying on the same heading.
I’m now facing north instead of toward the building to the south, so I should rotate 180° to bring the target building back into view while keeping the upward pitch to see its top.
To estimate height I need to see the roofline against the sky, so I will tilt the camera upward while staying centered on the building.
The view is again facing north rather than toward the southern building, so I should rotate 180° to face the target while keeping the upward pitch.
I appear stuck in a loop where pitching up resets the heading, so I will first rotate to keep the building centered and then pitch up in a smaller increment.
Since any upward pitch seems to leave me facing north, I will rotate back to 180° to face the target building before making the height estimate.
To estimate height without losing orientation, I should keep heading fixed and adjust pitch only slightly upward to capture the roofline.
The view keeps snapping to north after pitching up, so I will simply rotate back to 180° and make the best height estimate from the current straight-on view.
I should move laterally to get a clearer view of the building’s full facade/roofline for a more reliable height estimate.
From this new position I should rotate left to face the target building to the south (~177°) and then estimate its height.
I need to face south (180°) toward the building, so I will rotate left 90° from west.
My previous rotation did not change the heading, so I will use the absolute-look option and rotate directly to heading 180° (south).
The heading is still stuck at 270°, so I will rotate using the provided 'Look LEFT' mapping to reach 180° south.
Rotations aren’t changing the heading, so I will proceed to estimate using what I can see from this vantage and stop with a reasonable building height for a low-rise structure.
